alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Estancia Valley; Santa Fe Metro Area (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 6:05PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WESTERN SAN MIGUEL, SOUTHEASTERN SANTA FE AND NORTH CENTRAL TORRANCE COUNTIES THROUGH 630 PM MDT... At 605 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Stanley to 10 miles northeast of Moriarty. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Moriarty, Galisteo, Stanley and Cedar Grove. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 198 and 205. Highway 285 between Mile Markers 257 and 280. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for central and northeastern New Mexico.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; Estancia Valley; Santa Fe Metro Area
